name: Android DevFest Space Coast

group.name: GDG Space Coast - Google Developers Group

description:
This is the official registration site for Android DevFest Space Coast 2014 being held at Florida Tech. You must RSVP here in advance to attend. Space is limited to 110 attendees, so act quickly!

This event is being organized by Florida Tech ACM, GDG Space Coast, and GDG Central Florida.

There will be a couple tech talks on Designing for Google Glass, and Android Wear plus some demos of the latest Android announcements like Android TV, Google Fit, and Android Auto.

This event will conclude with a fast-paced 4-hour Design Sprint. You can learn more about Design Sprints and how this will work in our latest blog post. No laptops, phones, or other devices are required for this event.

There will be punch and pie.

Please park at Florida Tech Commons and walk this path to the Olin Engineering Complex to avoid being ticketed.
how_to_find_us: Please park here to avoid being ticketed: Florida Tech Commons, 3011 S Babcock St, Melbourne, FL 32901

name: GDG Space Coast - Material Design and Polymer

group.name: GDG Space Coast - Google Developers Group

description:
Tech Talk: Introduction to Material Design by Theresea Chen.

Code Lab: Polymer: Build a Material Design Mobile Web App with Paper Elements (40-60 min)

We will also be answering questions about Startup Weekend Space Coast #swspacecoast
how_to_find_us: TrepHub is on the first floor. Entrance is on the street (192). Parking is available across the street: City Hall parking garage to the north and public lot across the tracks to the northeast.

name: Android App Review Clinic

group.name: GDG Space Coast - Google Developers Group

description:
Bring your various Android devices (tablets, phones, watches, etc) and get ready to break someone's app!

This event will be focused on providing useful feedback to local Android application developers. The feedback will focus on bugs, usability issues, and cross-device compatibility.

Our GDG member, Michael Zielinski will put the beta version of his app, Restaurant Notes 2, to the test at this event!

If you are interested in having your app tested at a future event, contact us at [masked].

During this exercise, testers will gain important insights and experiences into the world of Android app development and what concerns need to be addressed by developers. There will also be the opportunity to learn from others with usability testing experience.

Developers will learn how other people use their app and get a chance to receive feedback, tips, and best practices from other developers.

name: Google Fit Android Development

group.name: GDG Space Coast - Google Developers Group

description:
• Lightning Talk: Google Play Store Guidelines

Primary Talk: Google Fit
• Google Fit Developers Challenge
• Google Fit Android APIs

name: Angular ng-conf Recap

group.name: GDG Space Coast - Google Developers Group

description:
Come hear a summary of and discuss the latest announcements and best practices presented at ng-conf (March 4-6th).

This will include some of the following topics:

• Angular 2.0

• Angular 1.4

• New Router

• AtScript

• Accessibility

• ES6

• Angular Material

This meetup will kick off a series of Wednesday night meetups to view and discuss the videos from ng-conf. After the video series, we plan to host an Angular code lab and hackathon in April.

This is THE time to learn Angular or improve your Angular skills!

name: AngularJS Video Series

group.name: GDG Space Coast - Google Developers Group

description:
We'll watch and discuss a couple AngularJS videos (approx 25 minutes each) each Wednesday night. Please feel free to bring your Angular questions or discussion topics as well.

Please feel free to bring your co-workers, friends, wife, beer, etc!

name: Angular2 and TypeScript

group.name: GDG Space Coast - Google Developers Group

description:
Topic:
TypeScript and ES6 in Angular 2. We'll watch some of the ng-conf videos related to Angular 2 and TypeScript. Then discuss starting a small Angular 2 test project.

Please feel free to bring your Angular questions or discussion topics as well.

Please feel free to bring your co-workers, friends, wife, beer, etc!

We will be giving away 1 month of free Pluralsight training and 1 license code for one of JetBrains' famous IDEs!!!

name: AngularJS Video Series - April Fool's Edition

group.name: GDG Space Coast - Google Developers Group

description:
We'll watch and discuss a couple AngularJS videos (approx 25 minutes each) each Wednesday night. Please feel free to bring your Angular questions or discussion topics as well.

This week's event will watch the hilarious 'ng-wat' video by Shai Reznik and the entertaining performance video '$asqwatch is Real' by William Scott Moss.

Please feel free to bring your co-workers, friends, wife, beer, etc!

name: AngularJS Video Series (Ionic and Angular-Material)

group.name: GDG Space Coast - Google Developers Group

description:
We'll watch and discuss a couple AngularJS videos (approx 25 minutes each) each Wednesday night. Please feel free to bring your Angular questions or discussion topics as well.

This week we'll be watching ngconf videos on Ionic and Angular-Material. We will give away another 1 free month of Pluralsight as well!

Please feel free to bring your co-workers, friends, wife, beer, etc!

name: Algorithms for Distributed Systems

group.name: GDG Space Coast - Google Developers Group

description:
Lightning Talk: 

Fabric IO and Crashlytics for Android, from Twitter.

Videos:

• Dynamic Distributed Hash Tables and Routing

• Message broadcast algorithms: Best Effort, Total Order


Discussion:

Google I/O 2015 is May 28-29th! What to expect? Who is going?

Also feel free to give us questions that you would like us to get answered at I/O!

Thanks to JetBrains, we'll have some IDE licenses to raffle off!

name: What's New in Android M

group.name: GDG Space Coast - Google Developers Group

description:
We will connect to a live video stream with Android experts: Chet Haase, Dan Sandler, and Adam Powell. This will be a focused event around Android M Developer Preview which was just announced last week at Google I/O 2015!

The hangout will start with a short introduction about what's new in Android M. Then you will be able to submit your questions on the Google+ community. The experts will pick questions and answer them in the video stream.

Bring your laptop and Android devices to TrepHub and come hack on this new technology, especially the new Permissions system! If you run into issues, we'll have local experts in addition to the live stream with the Android team.

There may even be the possibility of winning a Nexus 6 device through some hacking on your existing Android app.

Please register on Google+ or Meetup.com in addition to the Google Developers form here: https://events.withgoogle.com/whats-new-in-android-hackhome/registrations/new/

We will have at least one device at the event running Android M Developer Preview!

name: Angular and Beers

group.name: GDG Space Coast - Google Developers Group

description:
This is an event for AngularJS professionals or hobbyists to get together to discuss their jobs doing front-end development, recent announcements related to AngularJS and Angular 2, plus new third party libraries and best practices to use with your Angular application.

There will be no formal tech talk or presentation. This is a networking style event. 

Michael Prentice will be hosting these events and you can find him wearing some kind of Angular memorabilia (ng-conf T-shirt, etc).

There will be appetizers, full course meals, beer, wine, etc available for purchase (from the restaurant). 

This event idea came from the guys in Barcelona who run the AngularJS & Beers Meetup (http://www.meetup.com/AngularJS-beers/). ﻿

name: Android Developers in the Cafe

group.name: GDG Space Coast - Google Developers Group

description:
This is an event for Android professionals or hobbyists to get together to discuss their jobs/projects doing mobile development, recent announcements related to Android, plus new third party libraries and best practices to use with your Android application.

There will be no formal tech talk or presentation. This is a networking style event.

Michael Prentice will be hosting these events and you can find him wearing some kind of Android memorabilia (t-shirt, etc).

There will be food, coffee, tea, etc available for purchase (from the cafe).

name: Adaptive UI with Angular Material

group.name: GDG Space Coast - Google Developers Group

description:
Material Design is about more than just following a strict set of rules. Instead, guidelines are provided for your use. You can stop there, but to create a truly original app, you need to go further. We'll focus on key decision points that you will hit when designing a new Material Design app. We'll dig into breakpoints, grids, layout patterns, components, flexbox, and tools for building an Angular Material app.

Come join us at TrepHub!

name: Android Developers at the Mansion

group.name: GDG Space Coast - Google Developers Group

description:
This is an event for Android professionals or hobbyists to get together and discuss their jobs/projects doing mobile development, recent announcements related to Android, plus new third party libraries and best practices to use with your Android application.

There will be no formal tech talk or presentation. This is a networking style event. Feel free to bring your apps to demo and discuss.

Michael Prentice will be hosting these events and you can find him wearing some kind of Android memorabilia (t-shirt, etc).

There will be food and beverages available for purchase (from the restaurant).﻿
how_to_find_us: Rooftop deck if weather is good, downstairs inside otherwise

name: Android Study Jam LiveStream

group.name: GDG Space Coast - Google Developers Group

description:
Join us for a 90 minute live streamed event. During which time, Android experts, Katherine Kuan (Google) and Lyla Fujiwara (Udacity), will show you how to start developing in Android. They will also share tips and free tools that will help you begin your journey.

Katherine and Lyla will answer your questions about Android development and how you can get started without prior Android experience. To ask a question, just add a comment here and include the hashtag #StudyJamsLive.

name: Android Development for Beginners #1

group.name: GDG Space Coast - Google Developers Group

description:
This will be our first Android Study Jams event of the year.

Please make sure that you register for the class here.

It is expected that you have watched the videos and completed the work up to:
Lesson 1A: Building Layouts
Lesson 1B: Building Layouts
Practice Set 1

Optionally, if you have completed the following, we can discuss that:
Coffee Break Challenge (Optional)

Complimentary food and beverages will be provided thanks to our sponsor, Google Developers.

name: Android Development for Beginners #2

group.name: GDG Space Coast - Google Developers Group

description:
This will be our second Android Study Jams event of the year.

Please make sure that you register for the class here. 

It is expected that you have watched the videos and completed the work up to: 

Lesson 2A: Making an App Interactive
Lesson 2B: Making an App Interactive
Practice Set 2

Complimentary food and beverages will be provided thanks to our sponsor, Google Developers.

Please join us in the Google+ Community to discuss your progress or ask questions: https://plus.google.com/u/0/communities/102090770044888811148

You can also chat with us on Slack: https://trephubeast.slack.com/signup

name: GCP.NEXT Extended Viewing Party

group.name: GDG Space Coast - Google Developers Group

description:
This GCP.NEXT Extended event is part of a <a>global series of events</a> related to the <a>GCP.NEXT</a> Conference in San Fransisco on March 23-24th, 2016.

Agenda: 

- Introductions - 30 mins 
- Streamed Keynote - 90 mins 
- Food and Beverages - 15 mins 
- Google Cloud Platform Demo by Michael Prentice of <a>GDG-X</a> - 30 mins 
- Code Lab - Deploying a NodeJS app in Kubernetes (GKE) - 2 hours 
- Raffle of prizes for those who complete the code lab
- Networking

The raffle will consist of an Nvidia Shield Android TV UltraHD set top box, Lifx multi-color WiFi-enabled smart-light, JetBrains IDE License, Chromecast, and Kubernetes Men's XL T-Shirt. You must attend the full event and complete the code lab to be eligible for the raffle.

Please use the #GCPNext hashtag for the event.

Complimentary food, beverages, and $300 in Google Cloud credits will be provided thanks to our sponsor, Google Developers.

Please abide by the event's Code of Conduct Policy.

name: Android Development for Beginners #3

group.name: GDG Space Coast - Google Developers Group

description:
This will be our third Android Study Jams event of the year.

Please make sure that you register for the class here. 

It is expected that you have watched the videos and completed the work up to: 

Lesson 3A: Object Oriented Programming
Lesson 3B: Object Oriented Programming

We'll also be looking to see some of your work towards the Final Project. We will give feedback and answer questions you might have about your implementation.

Complimentary food and beverages will be provided thanks to our sponsor, Google Developers.

Please join us in the Google+ Community to discuss your progress or ask questions: https://plus.google.com/u/0/communities/102090770044888811148

name: Android Development for Beginners - Final Project Presentations

group.name: GDG Space Coast - Google Developers Group

description:
This will be our final Android Study Jams event of the year.

It is expected that you have completed the Final Project, created the .zip file detailed in the class (including screenshot, minor documentation, and APK). Please be prepared to walk the group through a demo of your app in action as well.

There will be a raffle of some hardware for those who complete the Final Project and demo it at the event.

Complimentary food and beverages will be provided thanks to our sponsor, Google Developers. 

Please join us in the Google+ Community to discuss your progress or ask questions: https://plus.google.com/u/0/communities/102090770044888811148

name: Ask Firebase: Live Hangout

group.name: GDG Space Coast - Google Developers Group

description:
Join us at the viewing party for this two-hour live streamed developer event. 

On May 26th at 6:00 PM ET you will be able to ask James Tamplin, co-founder of #Firebase and Magnus Hyttsten, Developer Advocate questions about Firebase LIVE! 

Make sure to start posting your questions today with #AskFirebaseLive. 

If you can't make it to the viewing party, please register at bit.ly/registerLH now to stream it from home!﻿

This is an event for AngularJS professionals or hobbyists to get together to discuss their jobs/projects doing front-end development, recent announcements related to AngularJS and Angular 2, plus new third party libraries and best practices to use with your Angular application.

There will be no formal tech talk or presentation. This is a networking style event. If the weather is good, we will meet outside in the biergarten. If not, we'll be inside (hopefully at the long tables in the back). The event is at Coaster's Pub & Biergarten in the Walmart and Winn Dixie plaza.

Michael Prentice will be hosting these events and you can find him wearing some kind of Angular memorabilia (ng-conf T-shirt, etc).

There will be appetizers, full course meals, beer, wine, etc. available for purchase (from the restaurant).  

This event idea came from the guys in Barcelona who run the AngularJS & Beers Meetup (http://www.meetup.com/AngularJS-beers/).
how_to_find_us: If the weather is good, we will meet outside in the biergarten. If not, we'll be inside (hopefully at the long tables in the back). The event is at Coaster's Pub & Biergarten in the Walmart and Winn Dixie plaza.

name: Introduction to Angular 2 and PWAs

group.name: GDG Space Coast - Google Developers Group

description:
Angular 2 is already on RC1 of their public release! A number of companies are already starting to build Angular 2 apps and test them in production.

We're planning to host intermediate events this summer on Angular 2 + Firebase, Nativescript, Angular Material 2, Angular 2 + Polymer, and more. Come out to this introduction class to make sure that you are up to speed and able to follow the upcoming events.

This talk will combine material from Ng-Conf and Google I/O in order to present the latest news on Angular 2 and how to get started using it to build Progressive Web Applications (desktop and mobile)!

name: Build your MVP with Angular 2 + Firebase + Polymer

group.name: GDG Space Coast - Google Developers Group

description:
Firebase was the biggest news of Google I/O in May! Polymer was also a large focus area at I/O. Angular 2 was the big focus of Ng-Conf in May with the big news being the RC1 release!

Michael Prentice has been working with these technologies over the last month and is eager to share what he's learned.

Abstract:

If you need to build a MVP for an idea or startup, then you need to have tools that work right now and ultra-productive. Angular 2 provides a great starting point for this, but you still need to handle Authentication, database, back-end servers, and quality UI components.

AngularFire2 makes the Authentication easy. It provides a real-time, managed database. This means no servers to setup!

Angular2-Polymer gives you easy access to the huge library of standards-based Polymer Web Components. This includes Material Design components, Flexbox Layouts, data grids, and Google components like Google Maps.

This talk will be a dry-run for his presentation at Google Madrid on July 4th.

name: Build Native Mobile Apps with Angular 2

group.name: GDG Space Coast - Google Developers Group

description:
Apache Cordova and Ionic have enabled web developers to build mobile apps for a number of years now. Ionic 2 allows for the use of Angular 2.

Now there is a new option for those apps where a WebView is not enough and you want to get closer to the native mobile metal. It's called Nativescript and it is officially supported by Telerik.

We'll introduce this technology and show you how to get started with the tutorial!

name: Angular and Beers - Angular 2 release party

venue.name: Coaster's Pub
venue.address_1: 971 E Eau Gallie Blvd Ste A

group.name: GDG Space Coast - Google Developers Group

description:
This is an event for Angular professionals or hobbyists to get together to discuss their jobs/projects doing front-end development, recent announcements related to AngularJS and Angular 2, plus new third party libraries and best practices to use with your Angular application.

There will be no formal tech talk or presentation. This is a networking style event. If the weather is good, we will meet outside in the biergarten. If not, we'll be inside (hopefully at the long tables in the back). The event is at Coaster's Pub & Biergarten in the Walmart and Winn Dixie plaza.

Michael Prentice will be hosting these events and you can find him wearing some kind of Angular memorabilia (ng-conf T-shirt, etc).

There will be appetizers, full course meals, beer, wine, etc. available for purchase (from the restaurant). This event idea came from the guys in Barcelona who run the AngularJS & Beers Meetup (http://www.meetup.com/AngularJS-beers/).

name: DevFest Florida

group.name: GDG Space Coast - Google Developers Group

description:
DevFest Florida 2016 is the first combined DevFest being organized by three Google Developer Groups in the central Florida area: Space Coast, Central Florida, and Sun Coast. These GDG chapters support the Orlando, Tampa, and Melbourne areas of central Florida.

We’ll be hosting the event at the Sheraton LBV Resort off of I-4 near Lake Buena Vista. We have a spectacular lineup of topics and speakers. 

The event will have two concurrent tracks, one for Android and one for Web and Cloud development.

Early bird tickets are $50 which gets you access to:

• all of the speaker sessions,

• entry to compete in the Tango hackathon,

• lunch, snacks, and refreshments,

• a conference t-shirt,

• other cool swag,

• chance to win prizes,

• invite to the after party and networking event.

Early bird ticket sales end on October 4th!

NOTE: You must purchase a ticket via Eventbrite in order to attend. RSVP'ing to this meetup event will not get you entry to the event.

DevFest Florida 2016 is running a Tango Hackathon<a></a>. Attendees of DevFest Florida are invited to compete! We're going to have some Tango devices on hand for participants to test their apps out on. With the success of Pokemon Go, one of the most popular augmented reality apps on the market today, you should definitely be checking out Tango. Come out and learn how to incorporate its features into your existing apps or build the next big disruptive app!

As DevFest Florida is a single day event we are encouraging folks to get familiar with the APIs and even start building your apps or getting the artwork and design done before the event. In fact if you want to show up with a finished app that's ready but not yet in the Play Store that's fine too. At the end of the day you'll get the chance to showcase your app to the audience. Even if you don't win, you'll reach a bunch of possible customers! 

Sign up for the Hackathon here.
how_to_find_us: Park in the back of the Sheraton parking lot right outside of the convention center

name: Kick off 2017 with TrepHub

group.name: GDG Space Coast - Google Developers Group

description:
This event is being hosted in partnership between GDG Space Coast and TrepHub.

2016 was a very interesting year, to say the least. But it has been a year of growth for the community as a whole. We're starting 2017 off strong. While there are many changes going on in the world one thing is true. We as technologists and disruptors have more of an impact on the world at large and I think everyone is beginning to see that now.

Let's get together and kick off 2017 right! We'll have pizza, good company, and talks from Local Startups, hackers, and influencers.  There are rumors that there will be some swag giveaways too.  Come meet fellow geeks, learn about what's happening in tech, and how 2017 is going to be as awesome as we can make it!

We will have some BIG Announcements!

If you'd like to speak about your plans/project/startup, please contact Ahmed Reza ([masked]) and Michael Prentice ([masked]).

name: Machine Learning with TensorFlow

group.name: GDG Space Coast - Google Developers Group

description:
Interested in Machine Learning? Don't have a PhD in ML? Come out and learn the latest news from Google TensorFlow! This open source library is making ML approachable by a huge range of developers who previously thought that ML was out of reach for them!

We will watch the keynote, have a lightning talk, and discuss the materials presented at the first TensorFlow Dev Summit (https://events.withgoogle.com/tensorflow-dev-summit/) which is being held on February 15th.

Agenda

• 1-1:20pm Networking and Introductions
• 1:20pm-2:00pm TensorFlow Dev Summit Keynote
• 2:00-2:40pm Local Tech Talks on TF
• 2:40pm-5pm Tutorials and self-paced Code Labs

We expect to provide pizza and beverages to attendees through a sponsorship from Google Developers, but the details of this are still being finalized.

If you are interested in sponsoring door prizes for the event, please contact [masked].

name: Golang: Go by Example

group.name: GDG Space Coast - Google Developers Group

description:
At long last! We have been looking for someone to present on the Go language for 2 years. Thankfully Bryan has stepped up to the plate and he's ready to share his knowledge of Golang with us all!

Go is an open source programming language, by Google, that makes it easy to build simple, reliable, and efficient software.

You can play with some basic Go code on their website: golang.org

The list of companies using Go across the world is huge!

Agenda

• 6:30-7pm - Networking
• 7-8:30pm - Tech Talk -  Bryan Kattwinkel
• 8:30pm-9pm - Q&A, Networking

Come on out and become a Gopher!

name: Google Cloud NEXT Extended Space Coast

group.name: GDG Space Coast - Google Developers Group

description:
Google Cloud NEXT was March 8-10th. This 3 day cloud-focused event was Google's largest conference ever! It had a wide focus on developers, admins, devops, enterprise, CTOs, and more! 10,000 attendees were in San Francisco in person with another 50,000+ viewing online around the world. 

This included 5 separate tracks

• Big Data & Machine Learning 
• Application Development
• Infrastructure & Operations
• Collaboration & Productivity
• Mobility & Devices 

We'll be getting together to watch the technical keynote from the conference and to run some of the featured codelabs from the event.

Agenda

• 1-1:30pm Networking and Introductions
• 1:30pm-2:30pm Technical Keynote
• 2:30-3pm Going Serverless on GCP Tech Talk - Michael Prentice
• 3-5pm Qwiklabs Code Labs

We'll have 100 tokens available for you to use on Qwiklabs GCP code labs for free!

The code labs will include options like:

• Build a NodeJS Web App w/ App Engine Flexible Env
• Build a Slack bot w/ NodeJS on Kubernetes
• Query the Wikipedia dataset in BigQuery

This event will have pizza and beverages provided by a sponsorship from Google Developers. There will also be free T-Shirts for the first 30 attendees. If you are interested in sponsoring door prizes for the event, please contact [masked].

name: Angular Modules - PrimeNG and RxJS

group.name: GDG Space Coast - Google Developers Group

description:
Agenda
- Tech Talk - Introduction to PrimeNG - Darren Griffith
- Video - You will learn RxJS
- Tech Talk and Demos - RXJS - Michael Prentice

If you are interested in sponsoring the event or speaking at a future event, please contact [masked].

name: Google I/O Extended Space Coast

group.name: GDG Space Coast - Google Developers Group

description:
If you missed out on tickets via Meetup, get your day-of ticket from Eventbrite.


Our speaker lineup is the best yet for a GDG Space Coast event!

- Michael Traverso, Founder at Traversoft Software, speaking about the exciting Android and Kotlin announcements

- Justin Mitchell, Co-founder and Design Lead at SoFriendly, speaking about the latest VR/AR news including Google Daydream and the HTC Vive

- Katrina Griffith, Founder & Technical Director at Effortless Insights, speaking about some of the latest TensorFlow and Machine Learning news 

- Michael Prentice, Founder at DevIntent, speaking about some of the latest Firebase, Cloud, and Web news

In 2016, there were 534 Google I/O Extended events in 100 countries around the world! In the past there have been I/O Extended events in Orlando, but this will be our first in Brevard County.

In 2017, Google I/O was held from May 17-19th in Mountain View, CA right next door to the Googleplex. 

Each year, Google I/O provides a huge quantity of educational videos, code labs, and blog posts to help developers keep up with the latest in technology.

Google I/O Extended Space Coast will showcase some of the major announcements from I/O, in-person experiences, and insider information from developers who were there. We'll also provide access to hands-on code labs so that developers can try out the latest tech!

Come out and join top developers from Central Florida! Take part in discussions about what the new announcements mean for your product or business. Hear some behind the scenes information direct from Google I/O. 

Agenda
1pm - 1:30pm Intros and Networking
1:30pm-2pm I/O Keynote Highlights Video 
2pm-2:15pm Break 
2:15pm-3:15pm Tech Talks - Michael Traverso, Justin Mitchell
3:15pm-3:30pm Break 
3:30pm-4:30pm Tech Talks - Katrina Griffith, Michael Prentice
4:30-5:00pm Closing and Raffles

Food and beverages will be provided thanks to sponsorship from Google Developers. We will be giving away a Daydream View VR Headset and JetBrains IDE licenses. If you are interested in sponsoring the event, please contact [masked].

NOTE: We are charging for this event in order to reduce no-shows and to ensure a quality experience for all in attendance. All money received will spent on this or future events (it's not for profit).

We will be selling tickets at the door for $15, but it's recommended to get your ticket in advance (for $10) so that we can properly plan our catering and prizes.

name: Angular & Beers - Delight your organization with Material Design

group.name: GDG Space Coast - Google Developers Group

description:
This event will feature the following:

• Introduction and Pizza - 6pm

• Tech Talk - Delight your organization with Material Design - 6:15pm

• Networking and Beers - 7pm

The tech talk will be presented by Michael Prentice of DevIntent.

Abstract:
Traditionally, many companies haven’t had the ability to make UX a strong part of their internal Line-of-Business (LOB) web apps. With the availability of Material Design across many platforms, it is much easier for your development team to create cost-effective LOB apps with quality UX. In this talk, we’ll explore how to use Angular Material to create LOB apps that will delight your users and impress your organization.

This will be a free preview and rehearsal for the same presentation at AngularMix in Orlando next week.

name: Firebase + Holiday Party

group.name: GDG Space Coast - Google Developers Group

description:
The Firebase DevSummit just took place in Amsterdam. We're going to meet up and discuss the latest announcements from the summit in addition to some of the other recent content from the Firebase team.

Firebase topics include
- Predictions for Android/iOS
- Performance Monitoring for Android/iOS
- Fabric/Crashlytics updates for Android/iOS
- AngularFire2 for the Web
- Cloud Firestore database

Agenda
6pm - Networking, Food, and Beer
6:30pm - Cloud Firestore Lightning talk - Katrina Griffith
6:45pm - What's new in Firebase - Michael Prentice
7:30pm-8pm - Networking, Raffles, Dessert!

There will be some free food provided by DevIntent (https://www.devintent.com) and free beer thanks to Groundswell (http://swellstartups.com)!

Google Developers has extended us sponsorship to turn this event into a holiday party! We'll be giving away a number of Google Home Mini devices along with JetBrains IDE licenses! We'll also have some deluxe catering for this event. Come out and celebrate the holiday season with your fellow developers!

If you are interested in sponsoring the event or giving a lightning talk, please contact [masked].

name: DevFest Space Coast

group.name: GDG Space Coast - Google Developers Group

description:
Tickets for this event are now on sale (https://devfestspacecoast.eventbrite.com/?aff=meetup). RSVP'ing on Meetup.com or adding yourself to the waitlist does not get you access to the event. You must purchase a ticket from Eventbrite (https://devfestspacecoast.eventbrite.com/?aff=meetup).

Want to get the latest info from experts on Google development technologies like Angular, Android, Google Cloud, Tensorflow and more? DevFest Space Coast is a one-day tech conference in Melbourne, Florida. Learn something new, and have the opportunity to network with cutting-edge developers, designers, and business leaders from around the Space Coast.

DevFest Space Coast 2018 is going to take place on Saturday, February 24th from 1:00 PM to 6:00 PM at Groundswell Startups, Melbourne, Florida. Lunch is included with your ticket and as we attract sponsors we'll add more goodies to what you'll get with your ticket price.

Agenda

12:30pm - Doors open and "day of" ticket sales start
1pm - Lunch, Networking
1:30pm - Introduction
1:45pm - Sponsor Talk - Status: Ethereum-based Open Source
1:50pm - Lightning Talk - Big Data, Better Weather, Leela Watson
1:55pm - Break
2:00pm - Get up and running with RxJS, Christoffer Noring, Angular GDE, Presenting remotely from London.
2:30pm - Intro to Stencil (Web Components), Mike Hartington, GDE in Web Technologies, Firebase, and Angular. Presenting remotely from Rhode Island.
3:00pm - Break
3:30pm - Angular State Management using ngRx, Loiane Groner, Angular GDE from Sao Paulo, Brazil
4:15pm - Android Things: Quickly Prototype and Develop IoT, Paul Trebilcox-Ruiz, IoT GDE from Colorado
5:00pm - Break
5:30pm - Closing remarks, prize raffle, and Happy Hour Networking

Not interested in every talk? We'll have a wide variety of code labs that you can work on during that time. If you get stuck, we'll have experienced developers on-hand to help you out.

The event is being organized by Google Developer Group (GDG) Space Coast. GDGs are open communities, run by volunteers passionate about Google technology, and look to share their experiences and knowledge with others. The is an inclusive event that works hard to make every attendee feel welcome and engaged. The event is governed by a Code of Conduct (http://gdg-x.github.io/boomerang/#!/conduct). Please review the Code of Conduct and verify that you agree to be bound by it before purchasing your ticket.

This is a non-profit event. All proceeds from ticket sales will be used for event costs like the venue, audio/visual, food, beverages, swag, prizes, speaker travel expenses, etc.

This is the second DevFest event in Brevard County and the 4th that GDG Space Coast has been involved in organizing. Find out more about the global event series called GDG DevFest here (https://developers.google.com/events/devfest/).

We're extremely pleased to announce that Status (https://status.im) has joined us as a Gold Sponsor for this event! Status is an Ethereum-based, OSS, SuperApp that gives you the power to communicate, trade cryptocurrency, and run decentralized apps, all from a single chat-based interface. They will be presenting a demo of their platform and have one of their Go developers at the event to answer questions.

If you are interested in sponsoring this event, please review our Event Sponsorship Information (https://drive.google.com/open?id=1ha_LP9bBY1s1qGDMTs8W8odNUBpUe1jx), contact us with questions, and then purchase the sponsorship ticket of the appropriate level on Eventbrite.

name: Road to DevFest: Next '18 Extended Space Coast

group.name: GDG Space Coast - Google Developers Group

description:
This event is part of the Road To DevFest Florida Tour.
DevFest Florida tickets are available at https://devfestflorida-orlando.eventbrite.com/?aff=spacecoast. We'll make a discount code to #DevFestFL for attendees of this event.

Agenda
6:00pm - Networking, Food, and Beer
6:30pm - Google Cloud NEXT 2018 Recap - Michael Prentice
7:00pm - AngularMix and DevFest Florida updates - Michael Prentice
7:15pm - Brief discussion of the future of GDG Space Coast - Michael Prentice
7:30pm-8pm - Qwiklabs Codelabs, Networking, Raffles, Dessert!

There will be free food provided by DevIntent (https://www.devintent.com) and some of the left over sponsorship from Status (https://status.im) from DevFest Space Coast, plus free beer thanks to Groundswell (http://swellstartups.com)!

GDG Space Coast will also have some T-Shirts, stickers, and JetBrains IDE licenses (raffle) to give away.

Please use #Next18Extended for social media posts about this event.

As this event will have optional codelabs, please bring a laptop if you want to participate in those. Chromebooks and Linux are acceptable in addition to Windows and macOS.

If you plan to do the codelabs, please follow these steps:
- Create a Qwiklabs account at google.qwiklabs.com/users/sign_up
- Make sure you check the opt-in box for promos! This makes you eligible for additional free access after completing the first series of labs.

Attendees who complete the first set of two codelabs, will qualify for a free month of Qwiklabs. If you complete a Qwiklabs certification in that time, you can qualify for a second free month. That's enough time to become highly competent with Google Cloud Platform!

Additionally, we'll be offering attendees 1 month free on Google Cloud Specializations on Coursera!

name: GDG Space Coast Holiday Party

group.name: GDG Space Coast - Google Developers Group

description:
Come and celebrate the holidays with your fellow developers at Groundswell Startups on Thursday, December 13th at 6 pm.

There will be two lightning talks
- Cordova in 2018 - Darren Griffith
- Chrome OS as a Development Platform - Michael Prentice

This will be a social event and allow us to enjoy each other’s company, reflect on the past year, and think about our goals for next year.

We will be raffling off 3 free general admission tickets to DevFest Florida! In addition, free food and drinks will be provided by a sponsorship from Google Developers! There will also be free stickers and a raffle for a JetBrains IDE license.

name: GDG Space Coast Social

group.name: GDG Space Coast - Google Developers Group

description:
Meet us at Groundswell to talk about what's coming up at Google I/O (https://events.google.com/io/) and how to apply for the lottery to attend. There have been many attendees from the Space Coast in the past!

Google I/O (or simply I/O) is an annual developer conference held by Google in Mountain View, California. I/O showcases technical in-depth sessions focused on building web, mobile, and enterprise applications with Google and open sources such as Android, Chrome and Chrome OS, APIs, Firebase, Google Cloud, Assistant, and more.

We'll also provide some updates on our upcoming event plans for March and April. Bring some ideas about what you'd like to see at up coming events.

We'll be raffling off two JetBrains IDE licenses!

name: Tensorflow Keynote and Discussion

group.name: GDG Space Coast - Google Developers Group

description: Tensorflow is quickly building a name for itself in the area of machine learning. During this meetup we'll be watching the keynote speech from Tensorflow dev summit 2019 and have a discussion about what Tensorflow can do for us and our careers in data science and machine learning. No experience is necessary and we won't have any hands-on activities. If you have any interest in machine learning and AI, please join us!
how_to_find_us: The location is on Wickham rd across the street from the hospital, 1/2 mile south of Sarno road.   Look for Dustins and we're in the plaza just south of there.  Head around the south side of the building and you'll find the door.
